intro: Mayepea bumelioides, commonly known as the Florida yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it has a fibrous root system. Mayepea bumelioides plays an important role in supporting local wildlife, including pollinators like bees and butterflies.
